full_summary:
### **VALVE, HEATER SHUT-OFF ASSY - Tender Reference: T8493-230002/A**
#### **Notice Issued:** April 26, 2023 | **Tender Closing Date:** May 5, 2023, 2:00:00 PM
#### **Supply Arrangement:** T8493-140035 Series

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites qualified suppliers to submit a proposal for the acquisition of VALVE, HEATER SHUT-OFF ASSY for Transport Canada's Air Services Directorate (ASD). The required quantity is one unit for the Bell 429 aircraft, serial No. 57273, tail No. 445.

This Request for Proposal (RFP) is open to qualified suppliers on the permanent list or who can meet qualification requirements. The Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and the free trade agreements with Canada's trading partners (Canada-Korea, Canada-Colombia, Canada-Panama, and Canada-Peru, as well as new traderequisites CETA/UK) apply to this tender.

The solicitation is being conducted under the terms of the Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP) and Supply Arrangement T8493-140035 Series. The following companies have been invited to submit a proposal:

* Aero Precision Industries LLC
* Aero Supplies Inc
* Non-Destructive Testing Products Ltd
* Bell Textron Canada (Contracts)
* ...
* Zepoli International Inc

The selected supplier will be awarded a contract under the Supply Arrangement T8493-140035 Series. The contract will be issued for a period of seven years, with options to extend.

All inquiries and requests for information should be directed to the Contracting Officer, Valerie Bourassa (Email: [valerie.bourassa@tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:valerie.bourassa@tpsgc.gc.ca) | Phone: 873-455-0980).

The documents may be submitted in either official language (English or French). The Crown retains the right to negotiate the terms and conditions of the contract with the selected supplier. Please note that this is an on-going opportunity for Qualification, and a new notice will be posted on GETS at least once a year to allow more suppliers to become qualified for the Supply Arrangement.
